ability.name: Final Blow
ability.text: If Heracross's remaining HP are 20 or less, you may make its Megahorn attack's base damage 120 instead of 60. This power can't be used if Heracross is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Megahorn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Kingdra.

attacks.name: Dragon Tornado
attacks.text: If this attack doesn't Knock Out the Defending Pokémon, and if there are any Pokémon on your opponent's Bench, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

cards.name: Elekid
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Mean Look
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat as long as Murkrow remains your Active Pokémon. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Squaredance
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Pokémon in play. For each heads, you may search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Raging Charge
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 damage for each damage counter on Granbull. Then, Granbull does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, then if, during your opponent's next turn, Phanpy would be Knocked Out by an attack, Phanpy isn't Knocked Out and its remaining HP become 10 instead.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Barb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Oddish.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Oddish equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Oddish has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shuckle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Arcade Game
text: Shuffle your deck, then reveal the top 3 cards of it. If at least 2 of those cards share the same name, put all of the ones with that name into your hand and shuffle the rest into your deck. If none of them do, shuffle all 3 into your deck.

cards.name: Darkness Energy (Special)
text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. At the end of every turn, put 1 damage counter on the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to, unless it's or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Jumpluff, if it has any.

cards.name: Magby
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Sputter
attacks.text: All Pokémon Powers stop working until the end of your next turn.

cards.name: Double Gust
text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, your opponent chooses 1 of them and switches it with your Active Pokémon. Then, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Moo-Moo Milk
text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Flip 2 coins. Remove 2 damage counters times the number of heads from that Pokémon. If the Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Riptide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 damage times the number of Energy cards in your discard pile. Then, shuffle all Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Gigaspark
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Berserk
ability.text: When you play Feraligatr from your hand, flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 5 cards from your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 5 cards from your deck.

attacks.name: Chomp
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on Feraligatr. This attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Energy card, a Energy card, and a Energy card attached to Lugia in order to use this attack.

ability.name: Wild Growth
ability.text: As long as Meganium is in play, each Grass Energy card attached to your Grass Pokémon instead provides GrassGrass. This power stops working while Meganium is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Fire Recharge
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Fire Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to Typhlosion. If tails, this attack does 60 damage.

cards.name: Metal Energy (Special)
text: Damage done to Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to isn't , whenever it damages a Pokémon, reduce that damage by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Metal Energy provides Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Cleffa
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 7 cards.

cards.name: Professor Elm
text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 7 cards. You can't play any more Trainer cards this turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Beat Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play (including this one). This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pollen Shield
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Bayleef can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. (All other effects of attacks, Pokémon Powers, and Trainer cards still happen.)

attacks.name: Sweep Away
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Sprout Tower
text: All damage done by Pokémon's attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Flaaffy in order to use this attack. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Take 1 Energy card attached to Flaaffy and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Hydroelectric Power
ability.text: You may make Floodlight do 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn but not used to pay for Floodlight's Energy cost. This power can't be used if Lanturn is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Floodlight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Baton Pass
attacks.text: If you have any Pokémon on your Bench, remove all Energy cards from Ledian and attach them to 1 of those Pokémon, then switch Ledian with that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Milk Drink
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Remove 2 damage counters times the number of heads from Miltank. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Quilava in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Fire Wind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. Flip 2 coins. For each heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Char
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon doesn't have a Char counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, put a Char counter on it. A Char counter requires your opponent to flip a coin after every turn. If tails, put 2 damage counters on the Pokémon with that Char counter. (Char counters stay on the Pokémon as long as it's in play.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Deflector
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Chikorita takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Chikorita during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Chikorita is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Chinchou.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 1 Energy card attached to Cyndaquil.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
text: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Sprout
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Hoppip and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Fin Slap
attacks.text: If an attack damaged Horsea during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If not, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Undulate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mantine.

cards.name: Berry
text: At any time between turns, if there are at least 2 damage counters on the Pokémon Berry is attached to, you may remove 2 of them and discard Berry. At the start of each turn, if there are at least 2 damage counters on the Pokémon Berry is attached to, remove 2 of them and discard Berry.

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Onix.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Slowpoke but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Sudowoodo.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Totodile.

cards.name: Ecogym
text: Whenever an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card discards another player's non- Energy card from a Pokémon, return that Energy card to its owner's hand. (Energy cards that are discarded when that Pokémon is Knocked Out don't count.)

cards.name: Energy Charge
text: Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Mary
text: Draw 2 cards. Then, shuffle 2 cards from your hand into your deck.

cards.name: Super Energy Retrieval
text: Trade 2 of the other cards in your hand for 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile. If you have fewer than 4 basic Energy cards there, take all of them.

cards.name: Time Capsule
text: Your opponent may choose 5 Basic Pokémon, Evolution, and/or basic Energy cards in his or her discard pile. (If your opponent doesn't have that many, he or she chooses all or none of them.) If your opponent chooses any cards, he or she shuffles them into his or her deck. Either way, you may do the same, and you can't play any more Trainer cards this turn.

cards.name: Bill's Teleporter
text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw 4 cards.

cards.name: Gold Berry
text: At any time between turns, if there are at least 4 damage counters on the Pokémon Gold Berry is attached to, you may remove 4 of them and discard Gold Berry. At the start of each turn, if there are at least 4 damage counters on the Pokémon Gold Berry is attached to, remove 4 of them and discard Gold Berry.

cards.name: New Pokedex
text: Shuffle your deck. Then, look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

cards.name: Recycle Energy
text: Recycle Energy provides 1 Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.) If this card is put into your discard pile from play, return it to your hand.

cards.name: Super Rod
text: Flip a coin. If heads, put an Evolution card from your discard pile, if any, into your hand. If tails, put a Basic Pokémon card from your discard pile, if any, into your hand.

attacks.name: Bubble Shower
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Herbal Scent
ability.text: When you play Meganium from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from all Grass Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Pichu
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Zzzap
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon in play that has a Pokémon Power. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, all damage done by attacks to Skarmory during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Super Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an attack of 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Super Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togetic's type is still .) Togetic performs that attack. (Togetic can make that attack even if it does not have the appropriate number or type of Energy attached to it necessary to make the attack.)

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Togetic; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Pilfer
attacks.text: Shuffle Aipom and all cards attached to it into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Spider Web
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. (Benching or evolving that Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Poison Bite
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Ariados equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Ariados has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jaw Clamp
attacks.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, as long as Croconaw is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat, and if the effect of an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card would change that player's Active Pokémon, that part of the effect does nothing.

ability.name: Glaring Gaze
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Noctowl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Static Electricity
attacks.text: For each Mareep in play, you may search your deck for a Energy card and attach it to Mareep. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Pikachu.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, until the end of your opponent's next turn the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may attach up to 2 Energy cards from your hand to Sunkern.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Sunkern equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Sunkern has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Sweet Nectar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flower Dance
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of cards with Bellossom in their names that you have in play (including this one).

ability.name: Mind Games
ability.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card, you may flip a coin. If heads, that card does nothing. Put it on top of your opponent's deck. This power can't be used if Slowking is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mind Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

ability.name: Fire Boost
ability.text: When you play Typhlosion from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to Typhlosion. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Flame Wheel
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy cards attached to Typhlosion in order to use this attack. Do 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Donphan.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if any of your Pokémon have any damage counters on them, then remove 2 damage counters from 1 of them (or 1 if it only has 1). If tails and if any of your opponent's Pokémon have any damage counters on them, choose 1 of them and remove 2 damage counters from it (or 1 if it only has 1).

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Strange Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused; if tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sticky Nectar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and, until the end of your opponent's next turn, as long as Gloom is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat, and if the effect of an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card would change that player's Active Pokémon, that part of the effect does nothing. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack. (Benching or evolving the Defending Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Sunflora is now Confused (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Cyndaquil during your opponent's next turn. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Girafarig.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
